page.title: 19ST MARY'S CUSTOMS
page.content: {MAYDAY. On May the first we have a Mayday ceremony.All the children are dressed in white clothes and the boys carry staffs (a pole decorated with flowers) and the girls carry possies.We have a May Queen (who is always eleven years old and is of a local family)She has attendants who are always eleven and seven years old.There are songs sung and the Maypole is danced by the older children.The infants also do two dances.After the ceremony the children have a special tea laid on for them.Then at seven thirty there is a Mayday disco for the Primary school children only. Once a year the Primary school children are taken to Samson (an uninhabited island) by the pleasure launches where they spend the day with a picnic, before returning home.
